intro: Bunium sampaioi, commonly known as the São Paulo fennel, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
